de.javasoft.swing.table
Class AbstractTableCellEditor<T extends javax.swing.JComponent>

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.AbstractCellEditor
      de.javasoft.swing.table.AbstractTableCellEditor<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Component type, used as editor.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.CellEditor, javax.swing.table.TableCellEditor
Direct Known Subclasses:
CheckBoxTableCellEditor, ComboBoxTableCellEditor, DateComboBoxTableCellEditor, FormattedTextFieldTableCellEditor, JYComboBoxTableCellEditor, SliderTableCellEditor, SpinnerTableCellEditor, TextFieldTableCellEditor, UneditableTableCellEditor
public abstract class AbstractTableCellEditor<T extends javax.swing.JComponent>
extends javax.swing.AbstractCellEditor
implements javax.swing.table.TableCellEditor

Base component editor for table cells.

Version:
1.04, 22.09.2010
See Also:
AbstractTableCellRenderer, Serialized Form

AbstractTableCellEditor

public AbstractTableCellEditor(javax.swing.table.TableCellEditor defaultEditor)
Constructor requires default editor as delegate. By default the editor doesn't accept null values.

Parameters:
defaultEditor - The default editor - see JTable.getDefaultEditor(Class)
See Also:
AbstractTableCellEditor(TableCellEditor, boolean)

Constructor requires default editor as delegate.

Parameters:
defaultEditor - The default editor - see JTable.getDefaultEditor(Class)
acceptNullValue - True means a null value will be accepted in editable mode.

applyErrorBorder

protected void applyErrorBorder()
Applies error border to the editor component. The method is intended to called by stopCellEditing() if an edited cell has an invalid value.

See Also:
getEditorComponent(), stopCellEditing()
